text:
New:

Boris Johnson had *two* meetings in No 10 with Theresa May this week, including one today 

He reminded PMof her commitment to Tory MPs that she would only serve 'as long as you want me' in wake of snap election

She made clear she will not stand aside, as per @dansabbagh
author: Steven_Swinford

text:
Telegraph splash:

Theresa May considers offering MPs vote on plans that could keep UK in the Customs Union, sparking Cabinet revolt

Cabinet minister: 'PM is in a very, very difficult position at the moment. It [indicative votes] would tip her over’
author: Steven_Swinford

text:
Two *very* different takes on MV3 from Govt within minutes of each other:

11.10

No 10: 'Consideration when bringing meaningful vote back is we believe we have a realistic prospect of success'

11.26

Kwasi Kwarteng: 'Govt fully intends to have a meaningful vote next week'
author: Steven_Swinford

text:
How MPs plan to take control of Brexit:

* Letwin amendment enables backbenchers to take control of Parliamentary business

* MPs vote on it on Monday. Expect almighty row as Remain ministers demand free vote

* Indicative votes Weds - Common Market 2.0, 2nd ref, CU among motions
author: Steven_Swinford

text:
Exclusive:

Eight Remain ministers *today*  warned chief whip they could quit if she blocks free vote on new bid to stop no-deal Brexit

Cross-party group of MPs to table amendment that could force PM to accept longer extension to A50 if her deal fails
author: Steven_Swinford

text:
Exclusive:

.@christopherhope reveals Sir Mick Davis, Tory chief exec, told MPs that the donors are holding back donations due to the lack of unity in the party

Sir Mick allegedly said: 'Why would people give money when you can't sort yourselves out'
author: Steven_Swinford

text:
Exclusive:

* Tory MPs told PM directly on Weds she must go. 'It's not that people don't believe you, it's that people don't believe you can deliver'

* Just hours before 2nd vote 15 whips confronted PM over leadership. At least 1 said she should quit

https://www.telegraph.co.uk/politics/2019/03/21/exclusive-theresa-may-told-chairman-1922-committee-tory-mps/ …
author: Steven_Swinford

text:
EXCLUSIVE:

Sir Graham Brady, head of 1922 committee, told PM on Monday that Tory MPs want her to quit over Brexit during meeting in No 10

He told her a growing number of MPs think the time has come for her to go amid fury over A50 extension

https://www.telegraph.co.uk/politics/2019/03/21/exclusive-theresa-may-told-chairman-1922-committee-tory-mps/ …
author: Steven_Swinford

text: This is absolutely amazing.
author: Steven_Swinford

text:
Here's problem PM faces in a nutshell

Last week Iain Duncan Smith was on brink of supporting PM's deal

Last night he told Telegraph: 'Why are we on bended knee to the EU begging for things we don't need? 

'Next week should be a simple choice between her deal and no deal'
author: Steven_Swinford

text:
This morning Jeremy Hunt said no deal would be better than no Brexit

While PM has been telling her ministers this in private, she will be acutely aware that it risks incentivising Eurosceptics oppose her deal

The refrain was notably absent from PM's public address last night
author: Steven_Swinford

text:
Fair to say Theresa May's Cabinet is *not* confident she will get deal through next week after that public address

One Cabinet minister: 'She is clearly trying to win over Labour MPs. It won't work, she is losing ERG support

'She pursuing strategy guaranteed to see MV3 fail'
author: Steven_Swinford

text:
Theresa May:

'You want us to get on with it. That is what I am determined to do'
author: Steven_Swinford

text:
Theresa May:

'I am not prepared to delay Brexit any further than 30th June.

'Some argue I am making the wrong choice, and that I should ask for a longer extension

'That would mean asking you to vote in European elections. What kind of message would that send?'
author: Steven_Swinford

text:
Theresa May:

'You want this stage of the Brexit process to be over and done with. I agree. I am on your side

'It is high time we made a decision. So far Parliament has done everything possible to avoid making a choice

'All MPs have been willing to say is what they do not want'
author: Steven_Swinford

text:
Theresa May addresses the nation from No 10:

'MPs have been unable to agree on a way to implement withdrawal. As a result we will not leave without a deal on 29 March

'This delay is a matter of great personal regret for me. I am sure you the public have had enough'
author: Steven_Swinford

text:
Eurosceptic Tory MP James Gray is not pulling punches tonight:

'Why on earth does she want to stay on? She must know she's gone wrong

'She must know she's the least popular Prime Minister in the history of Prime Ministers

'Why on earth does she want to stay? Time she went"
author: Steven_Swinford

text:
Theresa May's letter to Donald Tusk crucially *does not* say when MV3 will be held, instead stating that it will happen 'as soon as possible'

Some Cabinet ministers already resigned to it taking place during A50 extension period.

Julian Smith determined it should be next week
author: Steven_Swinford

text:
Highlights from a pretty extraordinary PMQs:

* Theresa May hints she will not stay on 'as Prime Minister' if there is a long Brexit delay

* PM accuses Parliament of self-indulgence and navel-gazing

* Eurosceptic Peter Bone tells PM history will judge her for extending A50
author: Steven_Swinford

text:
This will go down as one of the most memorable #PMQs for a long time

The Prime Minister has effectively staked her Premiership on a short Brexit extension

If either Parliament or the EU force a longer delay, implication is she will go
author: Steven_Swinford

text: Huge congratulations to @Laura_K_Hughes on becoming the latest Stern Fellow
author: Steven_Swinford

text:
Theresa May says a long extension would lead to 'this House spending endless hours contemplating its naval on Europe':

'This House has indulged itself on Europe for too long

'The British people deserve better than this House has given them so far'
author: Steven_Swinford

text:
BREAKING

Theresa May announces that she is asking for A50 extension until 30th June

'The Govt intends to bring forward proposals for a third meaningful vote. 

'As PM I am not prepared to delay Brexit any further than 30th June'
author: Steven_Swinford

text:
Part of reason for fury among Remain ministers is because of the way Downing Street is handling the extension issue

None of them were told that PM would be going for a short extension

First they learned was through a text message sent by No 10 to broadcasters this morning
author: Steven_Swinford

text:
Ministers want to see the letter

Despite No 10's assurances that the PM is asking for a short delay, there are concerns that there could be a caveat paving way to a longer delay
author: Steven_Swinford

text:
Here's cast from last night's meeting of ministers opposing long Brexit delay:

Andrea Leadsom
Penny Mordaunt
Michael Gove
Jeremy Hunt
Sajid Javid
Chris Grayling
Liam Fox
Liz Truss

They're seeing PM shortly

Despite No 10 saying delay will be short they're reserving judgement
author: Steven_Swinford

text:
Damian Hinds indicates MV3 may not take place next week

Says Govt needs to be sure it can pass. 

Could it now take place during the A50 extension period?
author: Steven_Swinford

text:
Barclay on no-deal under A50 extension:

'If an extension is confirmed... it will mean maintaining no deal scenario as operational focus.

'Cabinet will subsequently need to decide whether to futher intensify or scale back efforts, depending on length of extension'
author: Steven_Swinford

text:
Barclay says that ministers must retain 'public no deal narrative' regardless of whether extension is secured

He says departments should continue to prepare for no-deal on March 29 while also readying themselves for changing plans in event of extension
author: Steven_Swinford

text:
New:

Steve Barclay has written to Cabinet announcing Operation Yellowhammer - worst case planning for no deal - will be implemented on *Monday*

In event A50 extension not agreed over weekend Op Yellowhammer  command and control will be 'enacted fully'
author: Steven_Swinford

text:
New:

Telegraph's 1,000-word reconstruction of day including:

* Every cough & spit from bitterly divided Cabinet

* Suggestion Olly Robbins is pushing for longer extension 

* Leadsom *tonight* held meeting of Cab ministers opposed to long Brexit delay
author: Steven_Swinford

text:
Cabinet latest:

Several Eurosceptics - Andrea Leadsom, Chris Grayling, Liam Fox - made very clear that they would rather leave without a deal than have a long A50 extension

Some left with impression that Eurosceptics would quit Cabinet rather than accept long delay
author: Steven_Swinford

text:
Two hours in and Cabinet is *still* ongoing

The length of A50 extension, the DUP and John Bercow will feature heavily in today's discussions
author: Steven_Swinford

text:
New:

Whips are tonight alarmed about *this* exchange involving John Bercow

The Speaker hints he could enable votes on Brexit alternatives such as Customs Union by allowing neutral motions to be amended so they are substantive

'It's massive,' a source said
author: Steven_Swinford

text:
What happens if Bercow rejects MV3?

Here @nmdacosta sets out options:

1. PM has to prove House backs vote on MV3 motion

2. Introduce WA Bill with clause overriding provisions requiring a meaningful vote

3. ‘Crash session’ and have new Queen’s Speech
author: Steven_Swinford

text:
This is, to state obvious, a massive headache for No 10

Especially as PM has already given up on securing further changes to the withdrawal agreement itself

Expect Eurosceptics will be delighted - gives them significant leverage for case that there must be substantial changes
author: Steven_Swinford

text:
Bercow on MV3: 

'What the Government cannot do is resubmit the same proposition or substantially the same proposition as that which was rejected'

Translation from one Govt source: 'He's f***** us'
author: Steven_Swinford

text:
BREAKING

John Bercow effectively bars Theresa May from tabling MV3 unless it has been substantially changed, citing 415-year-old precedent

I can confirm that he gave the Govt *no notice* that he was about to do this

Theresa May is learning this at the same time as us
author: Steven_Swinford

text:
This is from Henry Smith, one of the wavering Eurosceptics:

'I do feel like I have got a gun to my head. It's an impossible and invidious situation to be placed in

'I had a text from Damian Hinds asking to talk. I didn't get back to him because I know the lines'
author: Steven_Swinford

text:
Also hearing one other pitch from senior No 10 figures to Eurosceptic Tory MPs

They are arguing that markets are undervalued because of Brexit uncertainty

Backing the deal will lead to a surge in investment and a potential boom
author: Steven_Swinford

text:
Here's Theresa May's pitch to Eurosceptic Tory MPs during calls this weekend in a nutshell:

1. It's the final chance

2. I'm working on the DUP

3. The mood of the country is changing. They are fed up

Her voice is apparently a little better than last week but not much
author: Steven_Swinford

text:
I'm told 30 Eurosceptic Tory MPs are still opposed to PM's deal & ERG calls over the weekend suggest positions have hardened

A lot hinges on DUP, but Eurosceptics increasingly believe she'll have no choice but to pull MV3
author: Steven_Swinford

text:
Exclusive

Jeremy Hunt and Sajid Javid will be "remorselessly" target by Eurosceptics during next Tory leadership campaign after voting to extend A50

Senior Eurosceptic: 'I don't think that the membership will vote for someone who voted to extend A50'

https://www.telegraph.co.uk/politics/2019/03/15/sajid-javid-jeremy-hunt-will-remorselessly-targeted-brexiteers/ …
author: Steven_Swinford

text:
Exclusive

Downing Street aides say Theresa May is 'finished' and may be forced to set out timetable for her departure to save her Brexit deal

Two senior No10 figures believe the PM should 'fall on her sword' to ensure she is able to 'go with dignity'
author: Steven_Swinford
